pe":"bytes32","name":"channelId","type":"bytes32"}],"name":"VetoWithdraw","type":"event"}],"devdoc":{"details":"This library doesn't need \"withdraw pattern\" because both peers must be  External Owned Accounts(EOA) since their signatures are required in openChannel.","methods":{"clearPays(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32,address,bytes)":{"params":{"_channelId":"ID of the channel","_payIdList":"bytes of a pay id list","_peerFrom":"address of the peer who send out funds","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"}},"confirmSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32)":{"details":"This must be called after settleFinalizedTime","params":{"_channelId":"ID of the channel","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"}},"confirmWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32)":{"details":"anyone can confirm a withdrawal intent","params":{"_channelId":"ID of the channel","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"}},"cooperativeSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"params":{"_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract","_settleRequest":"bytes of cooperative settle request message"}},"cooperativeWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"params":{"_cooperativeWithdrawRequest":"bytes of cooperative withdraw request message","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"}},"deposit(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32,address,uint256)":{"details":"total deposit amount = msg.value(must be 0 for ERC20) + _transferFromAmount.  library function can't be payable but can read msg.value in caller's context.","params":{"_channelId":"ID of the channel","_receiver":"address of the receiver","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract","_transferFromAmount":"amount of funds to be transfered from EthPool for ETH  or ERC20 contract for ERC20 tokens"}},"getCelerWallet(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage)":{"params":{"_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"},"return":"CelerWallet address"},"getChannelStatusNum(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,uint256)":{"params":{"_channelStatus":"query channel status converted to uint","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"},"return":"channel number of the status"},"getEthPool(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage)":{"params":{"_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"},"return":"EthPool address"},"getPayRegistry(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage)":{"params":{"_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"},"return":"PayRegistry address"},"intendSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"details":"simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means intendSettle natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  A simplex state with non-zero seqNum (non-null state) must be co-signed by both peers,  while a simplex state with seqNum=0 (null state) only needs to be signed by one peer.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].","params":{"_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract","_signedSimplexStateArray":"bytes of SignedSimplexStateArray message"}},"intendWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32,uint256,bytes32)":{"details":"only peers can call intendWithdraw","params":{"_amount":"amount of funds to withdraw","_channelId":"ID of the channel","_recipientChannelId":"withdraw to receiver address if 0,  otherwise deposit to receiver address in the recipient channel","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"}},"openChannel(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"details":"library function can't be payable but can read msg.value in caller's context","params":{"_openRequest":"bytes of open channel request message","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"}},"snapshotStates(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"details":"simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means snapshotStates natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  This function only updates seqNum, transferOut, pendingPayOut of each on-chain  simplex state. It can't ensure that the pending pays will be cleared during  settling the channel, which requires users call intendSettle with the same state.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].","params":{"_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract","_signedSimplexStateArray":"bytes of SignedSimplexStateArray message"}},"vetoWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32)":{"details":"only peers can veto a withdrawal intent;  peers can veto a withdrawal intent even after (requestTime + disputeTimeout)","params":{"_channelId":"ID of the channel","_self":"storage data of CelerLedger contract"}}},"title":"Ledger Operation Library"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"clearPays(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32,address,bytes)":{"notice":"Read payment results and add results to corresponding simplex payment channel"},"confirmSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32)":{"notice":"Confirm channel settlement"},"confirmWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32)":{"notice":"Confirm channel withdrawal"},"cooperativeSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"notice":"Cooperatively settle the channel"},"cooperativeWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"notice":"Cooperatively withdraw specific amount of balance"},"deposit(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Deposit ETH or ERC20 tokens into the channel"},"getCelerWallet(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage)":{"notice":"Return CelerWallet used by this CelerLedger contract"},"getChannelStatusNum(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,uint256)":{"notice":"Return channel number of given status in this contract"},"getEthPool(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage)":{"notice":"Return EthPool used by this CelerLedger contract"},"getPayRegistry(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage)":{"notice":"Return PayRegistry used by this CelerLedger contract"},"intendSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"notice":"Intend to settle channel(s) with an array of signed simplex states"},"intendWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Intend to withdraw funds from channel"},"openChannel(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"notice":"Open a state channel through auth withdraw message"},"snapshotStates(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes)":{"notice":"Store signed simplex states on-chain as checkpoints"},"vetoWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,bytes32)":{"notice":"Veto current withdrawal intent"}},"notice":"CelerLedger library of basic ledger devdoc.details: This library doesn't need "withdraw pattern" because both peers must be  External Owned Accounts(EOA) since their signatures are required in openChannel.

params._payIdList: bytes of a pay id list
params._peerFrom: address of the peer who send out funds

confirmSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storag.details: This must be called after settleFinalizedTime

confirmWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger stor.details: anyone can confirm a withdrawal intent

params._settleRequest: bytes of cooperative settle request message

params._cooperativeWithdrawRequest: bytes of cooperative withdraw request message

deposit(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,byte.details: total deposit amount = msg.value(must be 0 for ERC20) + _transferFromAmount.  library function can't be payable but can read msg.value in caller's context.

params._transferFromAmount: amount of funds to be transfered from EthPool for ETH  or ERC20 contract for ERC20 tokens

params._channelStatus: query channel status converted to uint

intendSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage.details: simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means intendSettle natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  A simplex state with non-zero seqNum (non-null state) must be co-signed by both peers,  while a simplex state with seqNum=0 (null state) only needs to be signed by one peer.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].

params._recipientChannelId: withdraw to receiver address if 0,  otherwise deposit to receiver address in the recipient channel

openChannel(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,.details: library function can't be payable but can read msg.value in caller's context

params._openRequest: bytes of open channel request message

snapshotStates(LedgerStruct.Ledger stora.details: simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means snapshotStates natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  This function only updates seqNum, transferOut, pendingPayOut of each on-chain  simplex state. It can't ensure that the pending pays will be cleared during  settling the channel, which requires users call intendSettle with the same state.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].

vetoWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage.details: only peers can veto a withdrawal intent;  peers can veto a withdrawal intent even after (requestTime + disputeTimeout)

devdoc.title: Ledger Operation Library

clearPays(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,by.notice: Read payment results and add results to corresponding simplex payment channel

cooperativeWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger.notice: Cooperatively withdraw specific amount of balance

deposit(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,byte.notice: Deposit ETH or ERC20 tokens into the channel

getCelerWallet(LedgerStruct.Ledger stora.notice: Return CelerWallet used by this CelerLedger contract

getChannelStatusNum(LedgerStruct.Ledger.notice: Return channel number of given status in this contract

getEthPool(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage).notice: Return EthPool used by this CelerLedger contract

getPayRegistry(LedgerStruct.Ledger stora.notice: Return PayRegistry used by this CelerLedger contract

intendSettle(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage.notice: Intend to settle channel(s) with an array of signed simplex states

intendWithdraw(LedgerStruct.Ledger stora.notice: Intend to withdraw funds from channel

openChannel(LedgerStruct.Ledger storage,.notice: Open a state channel through auth withdraw message

snapshotStates(LedgerStruct.Ledger stora.notice: Store signed simplex states on-chain as checkpoints

userdoc.notice: CelerLedger library of basic ledger operations
